topics.body: A show got cancelled? What show? I desire details on this story. Please.
topics.author: 500757fd7f123b75a90003b1

topics.body:
"@Princessâ™ Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b5d5a76368725808000200#post_53b5d5a76368725808000200

The Cartoon Network show Clarence is being temporarily taken off air. The show's creator and voice for a character sexually assaulted people working at CN, and he has been fired and banned from the studio. 

As much as I dislike the show, this is terrible.

EDIT: Looked at some articles concerning it. The sources I'm looking at seem to differ. Some seem to imply that it was more than one female coworker whom he assaulted, others say that it was only one. So I'm honestly not sure.

Actually, it seems like they haven't gathered any substantial evidence to prove that he did this yet; however he apparently has some sort of history of doing things like this? It's bit of a mess.
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b5d9766368720167170000#post_53b5d9766368720167170000
Personally I think the fucker deserved to get fired.
If he did it of course.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b5dc336368725808eb0300#post_53b5dc336368725808eb0300

Yeah, you just don't do shit like that. I just want to know what exactly he _did._ Sexual assault is such a broad term. And, like I said before, a lot of sources are saying that there's a lack of proof behind the supposed assault.

Not that I can really blame the victim for not wanting to talk about it to the general public.
